dialogue.string: 1�Is that true?Yes. It was out of concern.No. I didn't feel like it.
1�I suppose I should thank you...
1�...but I really wish you had told me anyway.
1� , why are you being so mean!?
1�That's not like you. I know it.
1�Please! Calm down and listen to what we have to say!
1�We're going to restore the World Tree, and we want you to witness it.
1�So I told him he could come along.
1�...Minister Melvien?
1�What would bring you to Kamihr...?
1�Melvien, about that book...
1�Well...he serves in Adoulin as the minister of finance...
1�We're ready.
1�Look,  ...it's really true.
1�Thank goodness...
1�At least there's something to...be thankful...for...
1�This should prevent Hades from rising up again.
1�...You're right! I can, and I must!
1�Morimar...thank you.
1�Mere words are not enough.
1�Hmm...Morimar's not here. I wonder where he could...
1�Nicewoman? I...suppose?
1�At the peak of the mountain?
1�Aha, with Sajj'aka!
1�Thank you for letting us know.
1�Then it really was the World Tree that protected us these long years.
1�How can we hope to fight against such an abomination?
1�How would it...?
1�I had completely forgotten--!
1�So we use the flowers to--
1�I'll do it!
1�I'll go on back,  . I know you and Morimar can handle it.
1�Morimar. Darrcuiln.
1�And  . Tell me, just where were you off to?
1�I won't let you off so easy!
1�You have to promise never to leave me behind again!
1�Ahem! I can't hear you!
1�I'm going to hold you to that! If you try again, I'll follow right on your tail anyway!
1�Balamor!?
1�...You're right! I can, and I must!
4�So ya made it, after all.
1�Sometimes the truth is right under yer nose, and ya just don't know it. We thought this place was destroyed and buried centuries ago.
1�This is Leafallia, the sacred home of the leafkin...and the site where the World Tree was first planted.
1�To think that we're actually here!
1�I know you're itchin' to get started, but we've got to wait for Darrcuiln to bring your princess.
1�How's 'bout takin' a look around while ya wait?
1�Glad you could make it.
1�That's why ?[he/she] didn't tell ya.
1�Graaah, ya lunkheads need to clam up before I get angry!
1�We're tryin' to make the World Tree whole again, and the lot of ya are just gettin' in the way!
1�Oh, come on! What would she possibly have to gain from lyin'?
1�Arciela, don't worry about them. They listen about as well as a berserk Goblin.
1�<Sigh> See what I mean? For a bunch of bodiless spirits, they sure act up like little kids.
1�So this is the stubborn Ygnas?Bwahaha! Look at the sheen on those verdant leaves. How many gardeners does it take to keep you so perfectly pruned?
1�Oh ho, I meant no offense. He just looks so...regal.
1�When will you ever...<Sigh> There's so little mirth in the world. Can't you allow me just one joke?
1�Who goes there?
1�And the dangers of the forest didn't worry ya?
1�I like this one! Reminds me of ya, princess, with how yer always trekking about without a care in the world.
1�This is a sacred land, called Leafallia. If yer lookin' for history, then ya've found it!
1�That's the World Tree...look at what's happened to it.
h!� , did he get ya, too?
1�Bwahaha, those are some reflexes ya've got there!
1�Bwahaha, I bet ya have, Middle Land adventurer!
1�Me? I'll be fine. Merely a flesh wound, and it takes more than that to bring me down!
1�At least Rosulatia's safe.
1�I heard what happened--ya tried to protect her from harm.
1�That bluster about hatin' people was just a front, wasn't it?
1�The fabric of life is a strange thing, princess. When one thread ends, another begins. I'm sure ya'll be able to thank him someday...
1�But if ya need to cry now, then let it all out.
1�This's probably not something ya want to hear, but...Yer gonna have to report his death to the castle.
1�He's not some homeless beggar no one would miss. His disappearance'll cause questions.
1�First the king falls ill and is bedridden, next a minister disappears...people will be up in arms. ??It's the curse! It's the curse!??
1�But if people know he's dead, there'll just be normal internal strife. It won't be pleasant, but certainly better'n the alternative.
1�There's no need to tell everyone the nitty-gritty. I'll find some way to dispose of the body myself.
1�All you need to say is that you saw him in Kamihr Drifts.
1�That dull attitude won't move the hearts of Adoulin! With Ygnas as he is, the people will turn to you for leadership.
1�Adoulin wouldn't be the first nation ruled by a woman, nor would it be the last.
1�I'll handle the cleanup. Ya gotta go back to Adoulin with Arciela.
1�What're ya doin' back here? I don't recall puttin' out a signal.
1�Ya've already spread the news, right? Then it's only a matter of time before they find the body.
1�The princess'll need yer help now more than ever. Make sure she stays on the right path--for Adoulin's sake.
1�I know you're itchin' to get started, but we've got to wait for Darrcuiln to bring your princess.
1�How's 'bout takin' a look around while ya wait?
1�As we always suspected.
1�If ya approach it like any old foray, maggots'll be peelin' your skin off the walls.
1�The predecessors of what you call the twelve orders...over half of 'em gave their lives just to contain the threat.
1�Dhokmak might be the worst. The Zoldeff River over in Foret de Hennetiel wasn't always so noxious. Where his hand touched, the water stagnated and festered.
1�Nature has a way of fightin' back, and so do we. Even now, it struggles against the poison, and utilizes its potency to fight.
1�Think.
1�5????.In its own twisted way, the jungle has wrought life from the grip of death.
1�Those plants've held on for centuries, never once succumbing.
1�The secret ta resisting Dhokmak's corruption lies there.
1�Ya got it.
1�That'll be yer task. Gather as many as ya can so we can figure out how best ta use 'em.
1�  and I have other stuff ta be doin'.
1�And as we don't have the manpower ta do it ourselves...
1�Thanks, Princess. We're countin' on ya.
1�You got bricks fer brains?
1�We gotta put them down 'fore she figures it out, or she'll be furious with us.
1�I know your little leafkin Ygnas is chompin' at the bit, too...
1�...but we can't let the city's most vital figures perish now, like they did then.
1�And, well...what can I say?
1�I've got a soft spot fer that young'un.
1�One time, when she was a bit younger, she got lost in the woods and I sat by her side as she slept, keepin' her safe.
1�That's how Darrcuiln and I met her.
1�Heh. It wasn't for terribly long, but I'd never dealt with children before. We were in over our heads, weren't we, Darrcuiln?
1�When we said our goodbyes, I asked a few someones I knew ta make her forget about our meetin'--and forget she did.
1�Haha, they complained the whole time, but sure did their job well.
1�Well, then, we'd better get started.
1�I'll head ta Yorcia Weald, where Ashrakk'll be lyin' in wait.
1�Darrcuiln, you take care of Dhokmak over in Cirdas Caverns.
1�With you by our side,  , those fiends'll rue the day they awoke ta terrorize us once more!
1�Fer Ulbuka!
1�I-it wasn't all that, Princess. We just didn't want to see ya get hurt.
1�Yeah, we had no other choice.
1�I-isn't that right,  ?
1�If we're willin' to believe 'im, this thing here'll lead us deep within the turris.
1�Suppose I shouldn't have expected Hades ta be bursting forth from the front gate.
1�You know what we gotta do,  !
1�Together we stand, together we fall!
1�(Though my heart prickles to say this, we must not begrudge Morimar his actions.)
1�(It was the only way for even some of us to escape, for had we all tried to run at once we would have been struck down in an instant.)
1�(His sacrifice was an investment in our future.)
1�(And I, for one, know he will not bow down easily.)
1�(I have watched over the jungle with him for centuries. I can picture that smirk on his face, snarling, ??My death is not for you to decide!??)
1�(But the trees...they are beginning to shiver.)
1�(Unlike man or beast, they cannot flee to safer ground when darkness chokes the land.)
1�(Hades and his Cimmerian Adherents will come, threatening to trample all life underfoot as they advance.)
1�(And should eternal shadow descend, their wooden spirits will cry out, echoing across soil and sea.)
1�(They will ring with the pain and sorrow of a land once loved but now lost.)
1�(And you,  , are the only one who can stop it.)
1�(Let us stop Hades...together!)
1�<What we do here today is to restore the rightfuuul order of things. Nothing should change, and all will be as intended.>
1�<Sons and daughters, bear witneeess to Mother's revival.>
1�<I have seen all, childreeen. Both what you have done, and what has befallen the world.>
1�<And I have choseeen to put my faith in you.>
1�<Pure water is our sustenance, and shiniiing light our shelter. Without those, we would never survive.>
1�<Our Mother cries out for aid. Come, let us begin the preparatiooons.>
1�<Your preseeence here is most welcome.>
1�<The World Tree's roots have kept me keenly aware of the incideeents occurring throughout the land.>
1�<And so, too, do I see the reason for your aaarrival.>
1�<Forceees of the deep that your storied hero sealed away are breathing anew.>
1�<Their slumber was to be eternal, but the calamiiity has come full circle.>
1�<Our mother tree kept the darkneeess at bay, purging evil as it emerged and preserving the sanctity of the forest.>
1�<But her strength is not without its limiiits. You may think it a grand flood, but in due time it will wane to a mere trickle.>
1�<And I...soon I will join with Motheeer. Her life will be mine, and mine, hers.>
1�<You will. Our bonds will keep us close, always. The same way I am alwaaays with your founder king.>
1�<Keep my pome safe,  , and let it proteeect you during your hour of need.>
1�<We are all able to stand here this day because of the sapliiing you helped bring to revive Mother.>
1�<Remembeeer August. Remember the sacrifices he made to seal away the maladies afflicting this realm. It is now your turn to do the same.>
1�<Fuuulfill your charge,  . Ulbuka needs you.>
1�No one's looking forward to your dance more than me!
1�Rest assured, I'll be in the rafters until the final scene!??
1�Bring down the house!
1�Show your audience that you're no two-bit player in this most epic of sagas!
1�Yes, a saga...that I have orchestrated for you!
1�And what did you call yourself again?
1�Ah, yes.  .
1�Hahaha! Normally I'm not one to remember the moniker of one with so short a lifespan, but yours stuck with me.
1�My name? Skokkr Undrborn.
1�I realize that ??Undrborn?? doesn't roll off the tongue, so you may address me as simply ??Skokkr.??
1�Oooh hooo hoo! Yes, I see what those two were saying about your vibrant spirit. Humanity remains as curious as ever.
1�It can not only draw out the energies of my 3????, but also contain it and even twist it into different forms.
1�Outstanding. Your will and determination are utterly without parallel.
1�There were once many curious folk like my underlings meandering throughout my lands.
1�But none ever emerged victorious. Setting aside the question of good versus evil, let me merely point out that the scales of balance failed to tip so much as one ilm in one side's favor.
1�And then you came and flipped the entire contraption over.
1�Oooh, hooo! None can blame you,  , least of all me. Take pride in your works.
1�But I didn't invite you here to give you a treatise on the powers that be...or were.
1�I am here to give you a prototype sigil of sorts in exchange for the three you already hold.
1�What use are they to you now that their purpose has been fulfilled? A fairer deal you will find nowhere else.
1�I have the highest of hopes for you. Here, two things to get you started.
1�But next time, I'll need  $????.
1�Bring me one, and I'll give you another 3????.
1�I trust that your results will be exemplary, and would like to give you a little something...special.
1�Ah, but you already have 6????. Then I cannot give you another, for any information you glean would be rendered wholly indecipherable.
1�And the other thing--the 3????--if you need a new one, then you'll have to gather three more sigils for me.
1�You scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours, hmm? Isn't that how your world operates?
1�And I cannot make these precious tools out of thin air. That is in the realm of godhood, and I am but a humble experimenter.
1�Not that I believe in gods--or I that I don't believe in gods. I couldn't care less.
1�I only believe in what is observable.
1�Experiments and hypotheses are my bread and butter.
1�Oooh hoo hoo hoo.
1�Hypothesize and experiment. Then back to the drawing board and draw up more hypotheses to fuel further experiments. How else will we get to the crux of how the world works?
1�Not that I expect you to express much interest.
1�But let's turn for a moment to my underlings... Special spirits indeed, them.
1�They burn brightly, only to turn to ash and return to nothingness, waiting for the cycle to begin anew.
1�You must be looking forward to facing them on the fields of valor.
1�Oooh hooo hoo, and how I, too, look forward to that moment!
1�I hope to learn much from your exploits in the realm of spirits.
1�Let's see if you can put the screws to them, like you have so many before.
1�I await your most pleasing of results.
1� , I've given you all you need. Make it quick, and let me get back to my research.
1�It scares you?
1�Well, this is an unexpected turn of events. When I pierced into your past, I would never have expected one with memories such as yours to be frightened by a mere bauble.
1�Exactly how many battles have you experienced? Far too many to count.
1�Victory is filled with blood and tears, and you have bathed in more than your share of both.
1�Look into my eyes and tell me that's not the case.
1�You will have to bring me three more sigils should you change your mind--and change it you will.
1�Fine. But keep in mind that I require three more sigils to make another.
1�Do not disappoint me,  .
1�Then you shall return empty-handed, for I have nothing more to say to you.
1�...But perhaps I do. Research always bears fruit, and how can I turn down a request so politely worded?
1�Yes, perhaps...
1�Dvergr are known for our manual dexterity, and since ancient times have heeded the call of crafting weapons and armor of the finest quality.
1�But not all of us are cut from the same cloth. Surely you can appreciate this, ?[son/daughter] of man.
1�I never had a penchant for hands-on affairs, and dedicated all my time to academic pursuits, finally settling upon one very precise topic of inquiry.
1�Spirits.

1�All things, living and non-living, have a spirit. The more I study, the more I thirst for knowledge. I have lost track of the countless years I have spent in research, yet I am no closer to drawing a conclusion than I was when I started.
1�A Devrgr's lifespan is measured in centuries, yet every second that goes by without answers agitates me further.
1�This is my sole reason for living, and I will not rest until I am satisfied.
1�... , I am too involved in my research to humor your pointless comings and goings.
1�Ah, this is quite wonderful! The sky contains not a single cloud of doubt owing to your herculean efforts.
1�But we must act again before the rain threatens us.
1�I yearn to see how you stand in the face of the most dreadful of memories.
1�Yet I remain perplexed...If this sigil was but a fabrication, then why would I feel such an unfamiliar energy emanating from it? Is there some connection that escapes my gaze?
1�Ah, but that only means I have yet one more subject to research. I shall take my time and dissect this curious specimen.
1�Go forth,  , and let the seeds I have sown bloom and flourish!
1�You don't wish to return your 3????, do you?
1�Humanity is fickle, indeed. But don't flatter yourself to think I care one onz about your inner workings. Know only that if you return it, the sigils will fully dissipate.
1�Be warned that you will have to bring 6???? should you desire another.
1�Choose wisely, ?[son/daughter] of man.
1�Avarice is not a word in your vocabulary. That much I can commend. Perhaps that is one difference between humanity and Dvergr kind--not that I pretend to understand it.
1�Nor do I wish to.
1�?6???? is all you need bring me to receive another.
1�I'm far too busy to engage in small talk with you.6...But as you have done me a service thus far, I'll condescend to your request.
1�Let's see...6Aha. Perhaps this will be of interest.
1�My research has produced several interesting byproducts, the likes of which I have scattered about the world.
1�Those were lifeless dolls into which I breathed energy, simply to see how they react to their surroundings.
1�True, I could have found more handy vessels, but I wanted something more close-to-home to infuse with something based on my own spirit.
1�So what exactly have they been up to of late? Ah, perhaps I shouldn't have been so derelict in overseeing them.
1�Bah. They're just dolls. No use getting sentimental over them.
1�The entire enterprise is grounded in recent breakthroughs to codex techniques--the ability to transfer spirits from one place into another.

1�When a spirit is refined, it begins to glitter like a diamond bathed in ever-increasing quantities of light. But a spirit can only inhabit one vessel at a time, so there is a limit to how much it can grow during its host's life.
1�Moving it to another host, however, enables it to grow into something it ordinarily cannot, containing information and memories from a variety of its previous vessels.
1�The 3???? you hold now is exactly that which I have explained to you. Consider yourself lucky to be in possession of such a rare piece.
1�Continue, then, to help it absorb knowledge.
1�I have sent some of my most trusted assistants to the vitalized place you call the Middle Lands to manage these techniques, sharing them with the worthy.
1�Visit them should you wish to learn more. You can see the world from a completely new...perspective. Oooh hooo hoo!
1�I wonder about you,  ...
1�I do hate futile repetition, so take my words to heart this time--I have no interest in playing these little games with you.
1�If you wish to contribute to my research, then I implore you to only return when you have the appropriate results.
1�I advise you to make haste. Humanity's time in this world is quite fleeting, indeed.
1�Make the most of it. Take full advantage of your mind and body.
1�Oooh hooo hooo!Now this--this is something else! If you will...
1�Aha. So that's why...
1�Now that I understand, I must admit the whole ordeal was rather anticlimactic.
1�To think I was the one who started it in the first place...
1�Oooh hooo hooo...but that is a success in and of itself.
1�What's wrong,  ?
1�Ah, but I needn't even ask. You feel a bit left out, don't you? I can read it not from your spirit, but from your face.
1�The bearer of this sigil used to be a pupil of mine, also engaged in the studying of spirits.
1�That would explain the strange forces I felt upon first taking hold of the 3????.
1�And it only makes sense that I couldn't tell at first--his spirit was incomplete.
1�A partially broken spirit is lacking in information. It's of little surprise I was unable to ascertain its true nature.
1�I am able to reach an appropriate conclusion now that I have studied it in full.
1�??Full?? may not be the appropriate term, as it is only a fabrication of the real thing, but it looks like I will have to dismantle it.
1�To think that he was the first to fully succeed in implementing the techniques I was studying! The student had overtaken the master--bittersweet, to be sure.
1�Ah, now I remember what a bright, diligent pupil he was.
1�Humanity is flawed--but perhaps he was able to overcome precisely because of those same flaws.
1�His perspective differed from mine. Whereas I sought to experiment on others, he turned his gaze on himself. He must have learned something about transmigrating Galka in the process.
1�It would certainly be the right answer for mankind, pitiful beings whose lifespans are limited.
1�But still...
1�Was his conclusion really the one he should have been after?
1�Did he catch a glimpse into the true nature of the spirit?
1�Unfortunately, that much I cannot glean from this sigil. Oooh hooo hooo! My research continues after all.
1�But you didn't come here to listen to me wax poetic about the past.
1�Let me instead implore you to continue assisting me. He may have learned the truth, but I have not.
1�How invigorating this research has been! Every time I reach a dead end, the world breaks down yet another wall.
1�(Princess, be mindful of the toxins in the ground. The last thing we need is to lose you.)
1�(The memories taste of both sweetness and sorrow.)
1�(You should own up to your mistake.)
e!�(So that's the Balamor you have been on about. Surely a hard nut to crack.)
1�...No. How could it come to pass that one could find this secluded place? It's utterly sealed off, separated, and removed from the world.
1�Hmmmmmmmmm...If our research, studies, and investigations have taken a backseat for now, then perhaps we can discuss that special thing...
1�Then we have but one simple, easy, and altogether elementary task to do.
1�And if we're wrong, we just seal off, shelter, and bar the doors to the place forever.
1�Yet a spirit is a complex, difficult-to-understand, and nigh-incomprehensible thing made of many interwoven threads.
1�But your spirit is marked with memories of battles, fights, and struggles, each a shining star amongst the sky. We wish to view those stars close-up.
1�And return you will! Both to there, and to here!
1�Well done! Absolutely perfect and without flaw.
1�We have prepared, set up, and established three different...dimensions for you to explore.
1�That one opens to a land of  �[toxic miasma/biting winds/unending filth].
1�That one opens to a land of  �[toxic miasma/biting winds/unending filth].
1�That one opens to a land of  �[toxic miasma/biting winds/unending filth].
1�Your Goddess's protection may serve you well...or it may not. Go forth, and flourish in the thrill of battle!
1�Be healthy and hale!
1�Your Goddess's protection may serve you well...or it may not. Go forth, and flourish in the thrill of battle!
1�Be healthy and hale!
1�Spirits are only one part of the experiments, tests, and trials. The other part...is throwing yourself against your foes over and over.
1�Hehehe, and you certainly are enjoying yourself.
1�Much enjoyment to be had! Your soul beams at the very mention of combat!
1�Honored to receive your just reward!
1�Seek your charge in the ruins, the Serpentine Labyrinth, Outer Ra'Kaznar.
1�Your Goddess's protection may serve you well...or it may not. Go forth, and flourish in the thrill of battle!
1�Should you, for whatever reason, find the experiment...wanting...it would behoove you to visit Ra'Kaznar Turris.
1�Yes...in that chamber, visions of the most formidable of foes await you. And though they may be but passing fantasies, the battles will be no less demanding.
1�You seek no material gain, but only the honor and glory of the fight...?
1�Take this 3???? as a symbol of our respect, admiration, and optimism.
1� . Our master is not present, out running experiments, and has left for the time being.
1�?6????? Then go, take it, and be on your way. I'll keep your three sigils safe.
1�?6????? Then go, take it, and be on your way. I'll keep your 3???? safe.
1�Our master says that there's no need, requirement, or reason for you to return it. But if you desire to...
1�Make a choice, pick your poison, and decide quickly.
1�Do you have any other needs, desires, or wants?
1�Our master says that there's no need, requirement, or reason for you to return it. But if you desire to...
1�Make a choice, pick your poison, and decide quickly.
1�Do you have any other needs, desires, or wants?
1�?6????. Well done, good show, and expertly handled.
1�Do you have any other needs, desires, or wants?
1�Let me warn you, provide guidance, and be frank. That alone will not open the gates.
1�We'll be waiting patiently, calmly, and with bated breath.
1�Do you have any other needs, desires, or wants?
1�You seem to be enjoying, having fun, and finding pleasure in our little escapade. Those little charms of yours are proof of that fact.
1�They are special trinkets that our master has prepared above and beyond the sigils with which you are familiar.
1�Honored to receive your just reward!
1�Honored to receive your just reward!
1�We respect, laud, and venerate your decision. Go now, and see what the master has deemed fit to give you.1�
1�Yes, yes! Separated! But if ?[he/she] is here, that only means our master willed it!
1�Oho, quite special! An adventurer is the perfect guinea pig!
1�A straightforward task, yes! Carry out the master's will!
1�Close off! Understood!
1�Open the door, he did! Memories of battles etched upon completely new existences!
1�A most difficult nut to crack!
1�You seem confused, befuddled, and out of sorts. Don't worry--you'll know where to look when you return to your world.
1�You should feel honored, blessed, and proud.
1�Seek your charge in the ruins, the Serpentine Labyrinth, Outer Ra'Kaznar.
1�Outer Ra'Kaznar! Our master's experiments await!
1�Its energies will be consumed, dissipated, and fully extinguished when you use it to enter our master's ??testing chamber,?? but you can enter again by procuring another.
1�Seek your charge in the ruins, the Serpentine Labyrinth, Outer Ra'Kaznar.
1�Outer Ra'Kaznar! Our master's experiments await!
1�Some may call it a blood craze, a lust for battle, an inclination for combat, but our master is pleased at your successes, no matter the reason behind them.
1�Outer Ra'Kaznar! Our master's experiments await!
1�Be healthy and hale!
1�For there, you will find another testing chamber...one which may prove more to your liking.
1�And yet, since there is no substance to the terrors you will face, there will be nothing to be gained from your triumphs...if you triumph at all.
1�Very well...then honor and glory shall be yours.
1�We have high hopes, strong expectations, and great confidence in your ability to assist our master in his research.

1�Familiar indeed! And they are critical in our research.

1�(This is no laughing matter.)
1�(No. You were making fun of him.)
1�( , she is counting on you for words of encouragement.)

1�Well, this is quite the spectacle.
1�Then my eyes do not deceive me! That is, indeed, Princess Arciela!
1�When I saw a dainty figure riding atop a golden beast, I could have sworn my eyes were playing a trick on me--but here you are, in the flesh.
1�I can only thank my good sense in choosing to follow your tracks.
1�My dear, I have always been a student of history. Call it an intellectual curiosity.
1�I chanced upon quite an intriguing volume, and spent many a night poring over it...too many, perhaps. And I realized that I had stumbled onto a treasure.
1�Before I realized it, here I stood! I never thought the phrase ??lost in one's research?? could be taken so literally.
1�And yet I find myself more invigorated than I ever was in my manse. Lady of Adoulin, I believe I now understand your penchant for the wilds.
1�Of course, I remain but a humble student.
1�Melvien de Malecroix. Charmed, I'm sure.
1�A measure of caution is always prudent when venturing into lands unknown. But my pursuit of the truth overcame any fears I may have had.
1�Your approval is much appreciated. But if I may ask, just where are we? It is preposterous to think such a place would exist within the recesses of such an inhospitable locale.
